main.title: KATERINA KOVALEVA
main.citate: The theme of memory, the theme of touching a bygone life, has been very important to me since my youth. And so everything I do in art is in one way or another connected with memory.
main.about: On April 20, the installation 'If It Rains. Waiting Area' will be presented at the exhibition 'Personal Structures' at Palazzo Bembo in Venice, as part of the 60th Venice Biennale
main.citateAdditional: Maps are covered with roses, cities grow out of old receipts and forms. 'That which is good for nothing can always be of use to us,' wrote Jean Baudrillard. And this is what interests me in today's contemporary art - 'unnecessary' things, phenomena, words, people.

general.right-to-rest: Exhibition project Case History. The Right to Rest
general.bio-text:
born in 1966 in moscow. began studying drawing and painting at the age of 13 under e.e. rozhkova, a student of r. falk. studied at moscow art school no. 1, where she became close with future members of the 'world champions' group g. abramishvili, b. matrosov, k. latyshev. from 1984–1985, she studied at mvgphu (formerly stroganov), and from 1985–1989 at the moscow polygraphic institute. visiting the squat 'kindergarten' and the workshops 'on furmanniy' (1985–1988) had a significant influence on her further creativity. since 1986, she has been actively participating in exhibitions. a member of the creative association 'hermitage'. scholarship recipient from the ministries of culture of russia and austria. under the supervision of a. kornoukhov, she participated in creating mosaics for the church of the transfiguration in tushino and the church of st. mitrofan of voronezh in moscow. author of several mosaics, including in groningen (netherlands) and new york (usa). in 2017, she participated in the antarctic biennale project. in the drake passage, aboard the ship 'academic vavilov,' an exhibition of drawings by katerina kovaleva made in antarctica took place, which were later shown at the 57th venice biennale.
in 2018, a major retrospective exhibition of k. kovaleva 'routes of memory' was held at the moscow museum of modern art. in her works, the artist constantly explores the phenomenon of memory, its connection with the history of the country and an individual, referring to archival materials, documents, and artifacts of the past. such a major investigation became the exhibition 'history of illness. the right to rest', held at the rosphoto museum (st. petersburg) in 2021. this project is dedicated to soviet sanatorium rest, the theme of oblivion, and the decline of civilizations, and the artist continues to work on it. from 2022–2023, katerina worked on the project 'waiting zone', which was presented in the salt barn of the xviii century in tarusa and at the moscow museum of the history of the gulag. the artist creates works in which she tries to explore the phenomenon of waiting. in 2024, the installation 'if it rains. waiting zone' is presented at the exhibition 'personal structures' at palazzo bembo in venice, as part of the 60th venice biennale. katerina kovaleva is a regular participant in art fairs, and her works are in private and state collections in russia and abroad.
